webResources.textAttributionSnippet: (en) The present Sturefors Castle was completed around 1710. The village lord was Karl XII’s powerful head of the cabinet Count Carl Piper and, in order to meet his wishes, he knocked the extremely reputable architect Nicodemus Tessin d. y. for the mission. The result was a large three-storey building with protruding middle sections and high grain roof crowned by a bell tower. Carl Piper never had his castle finished. He was captured in the Battle of Poltava and died in Russian captivity in 1716. The estate was also transferred to Bielkes - https://www.europeana.eu/item/73/S_OM_photo_OMFB000572. AB Flygtrafik. Östergötlands museum - http://digitaltmuseum.se/021016419887. Public Domain Mark - http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/
